{"step_by_step_thinking": "Subantimicrobial dose refers to a dose that is below the level typically used for antimicrobial activity. Doxycycline is an antibiotic that is typically used in doses ranging from 100 to 200 mg per day for its antimicrobial effect. Therefore, a subantimicrobial dose would be less than this. Looking at the options, 20 mg doxycycline is the only one that falls below this range.", "answer_choice": "A"}
